message: I just pushed this code to GitHub: https://github.com/tswicegood/pyopen.vim
You can see how I'm using it here: https://github.com/tswicegood/my.vim/blob/master/vimrc#L36
The idea is simple: <leader>o, paste in a URL, hit enter, the URL is sucked into a new tab in Vim named "pyopen-<original basename>".
I decided to do this after copying-and-pasting a bunch of raw files from GH so I could have proper syntax highlighting on big files and such.

I'm curious for some feedback though.  This is the first time I've actually written a Vim plugin from scratch.  I'm probably doing this horribly inefficiently, but I thought I'd throw it out there anyhow in case someone else wants to use it.

another thing worth noting is that your plugin file does not have any information about the author, the plugin name or any other details. You should take a look at how this is handled in other well known and widely used plugins
I am not sure what your plugin does better than doing ":o http://example.com"
because that command grabs what you need via curl and loads the new buffer with it, from your readme, it seems this is the same (but please correct me if you think this is not the case)
I tend to do it a bit different but you get the idea: https://github.com/tpope/vim-rails/blob/master/plugin/rails.vim#L1-L9
